hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity-Driven Momentum Fade at Key BTC Psychological Levels
hypothesis_content.statement: In current NEUTRAL regime with reduced structural liquidity, BTC momentum breaks down at round number psychological levels ($90k, $95k) when 1-hour RSI > 75 AND cumulative taker buy volume preceding the level exceeds $500M with declining order book depth.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Post-October liquidity crash means market makers provide less depth at key levels. Momentum traders push price toward psychological barriers using remaining liquidity, but without sufficient market maker absorption, the move exhausts quickly. The $500M volume threshold identifies 'crowded' momentum trades vulnerable to reversal.
entry_conditions: BTC price approaches ±0.1% of round number ($90k, $95k, $100k)
Cumulative taker buy/sell volume over previous 4 hours > $500M in direction of level
Order book depth at ±0.5% has declined >30% from 7-day average
Funding rates positive but < 0.01% (no extreme leverage)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks through level by >0.5% with increasing depth

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If price breaks through psychological levels with >0.5% continuation in >60% of cases when above conditions met.
